byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Union of South Africa Premier Smuts denies war aid was forced, Assembly debate
snippet: CAPE TOWN, South Africa, Jan. 31--Charges that there would have been a rebellion of English-speaking South Africans if the Union had remained neutral in the war was made in the House of Assembly today....

headline.main: SOUTH AFRICANS DENY WAR AID WAS FORCED; Smuts Scouts Charge English Threatened to Rebel

lead_paragraph: CAPE TOWN, South Africa, Jan. 31--Charges that there would have been a rebellion of English-speaking South Africans if the Union had remained neutral in the war was made in the House of Assembly today.
